title: King Davids Peak
text:
King Davids Peak, also known as the West Wall, is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in the <a href="Central%20Highlands%20%28Tasmania%29">Central Highlands</a> region of <a href="Tasmania">Tasmania</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>. The mountain is situated in the <a href="Walls%20of%20Jerusalem%20National%20Park">Walls of Jerusalem National Park</a>.
With an elevation of <a href="Australian%20Height%20Datum">above sea level</a>, it is the 16 <a href="List%20of%20highest%20mountains%20of%20Tasmania%23Notable%20peaks">highest mountain in Tasmania</a>.
Like other features of the park, such as Herods Gate, Lake Salome, Solomons Jewels, Damascus Gate, the Pool of Bathesda, many features are named for places and people in the <a href="Bible">Bible</a>. The mountain is named after the biblical ruler of <a href="Judea">Judea</a>, <a href="King%20David">King David</a>. Its alternative name – The West Wall – is named after the <a href="West%20Wall">West Wall</a> in <a href="Jerusalem">Jerusalem</a>.
King Davids Peak is the most prominent feature of the national park, and is a popular venue with bushwalkers and <a href="Mountaineering">mountain climbers</a>.
